revised_title: Energy Balance of Internal Waves During JASIN: Observations and Analysis
tldr: This study examines the energy content of internal waves during the Joint Air-Sea Interaction Project (JASIN) and explores the sources and sinks of energy in the internal wavefield. The research focuses on the higher frequency bands of internal waves and investigates the role of wind stress, horizontal and vertical shear, surface waves, near-inertial waves, and small-scale turbulence and mixing in the energy balance. The findings provide insights into the dynamics of internal waves and their interactions with the ocean and atmosphere.
